message.raw:
Update debian/rules to fix Lintian errors.

- Strip *.sh suffix from installed script.
- Use gazebo-wrapper to avoid having to source setup.sh
  Paths are harcoded starting from the next release /usr/bin/gazebo
  should be replaced by a symbolic link starting from next.
  update-alternatives could also be used to handle this symbolic
  link and provide nice integration if gazebo should be totally
  coinstallable.
- Get rid of local copy of DejaVuSans.ttf and use the one packaged by
  Debian instead.
message.html:
Update debian/rules to fix Lintian errors.

  • Strip *.sh suffix from installed script.
  • Use gazebo-wrapper to avoid having to source setup.sh
    Paths are harcoded starting from the next release /usr/bin/gazebo
    should be replaced by a symbolic link starting from next.
    update-alternatives could also be used to handle this symbolic
    link and provide nice integration if gazebo should be totally
    coinstallable.
  • Get rid of local copy of DejaVuSans.ttf and use the one packaged by
    Debian instead.

message.raw:
Split gazebo into several packages.

Gazebo is now divided into:
- a main binary package (gazebo)
- a set of architecture independent data (gazebo-common)
- a library package (libgazebo1.9)
- a development package (libgazebo-dev)
- plug-ins (gazebo-plugin-base)
- a documentation package (gazebo-doc)
- a debugging package (gazebo-dbg, already present before)

- a debugging package (gazebo-dbg, already present before)

message.raw:
Factor and enhance debian/rules.

Makefile language is powerful enough to handle compatibility across
several Ubuntu/Debian releases so let's factor it.

Add support for multiarch and hardening flags.
Generate documentation in the architecure independant build target.

See:
- https://wiki.debian.org/Hardening
- https://wiki.debian.org/Multiarch

message.raw:
Add debian/gazebo.menu file.

The menu entries in Debian are handles through the menu system. Add an
entry for the main gazebo binary.

See:
- http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/maint-guide/dother.en.html#menu
- http://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/menu.html/
- http://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/menu-policy/

message.raw:
Change Gazebo section to science.

The "devel" section is dedicated to libraries. As Gazebo is an
application, it should not be part of this section.

message.raw:
Add debian/watch file.

A watch file is useful to monitor when upstream uploads new releases.
It is used by running `uscan' in the directory containing the debian/
subdirectory.

This file mangles usual pre-releases suffixes such as dev, rc, alpha,
etc. to make sure that the final version (without any suffix) is
considered newer. It also supports various files extensions in case
next releases are using a different compression scheme.

See:
- http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/maint-guide/dother.en.html#watch
- https://wiki.debian.org/debian/watch/

The lack of this file is triggering a Lintian pedantic notice:
http://lintian.debian.org/tags/debian-watch-file-is-missing.html
